overview.problemStatement: For a graph G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG let τ(G)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">τ(G)τ(G)\tau(G) denote the minimal number of vertices that include at least one from each maximal clique of G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG (sometimes called the clique transversal number). Is it true that if all maximal cliques in G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG have at least cn" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">cncncn vertices then τ(G)=oc(n)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">τ(G)=oc(n)τ(G)=oc(n)\tau(G)=o_c(n)? Similarly, estimate for c>0" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">c>0c>0c>0 the minimal kc(n)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">kc(n)kc(n)k_c(n) such that if every maximal clique in G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG has at least kc(n)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">kc(n)kc(n)k_c(n) vertices then &#x
